pr_title: SONARJAVA-3359 Rule S5783: Tested checked exception should be expected from one single call

timeline.bodyText: JUnit4 also supports assertions with messages - unfortunately as first parameter, different to JUnit5 (e.g. https://junit.org/junit4/javadoc/latest/src-html/org/junit/Assert.html#line.998). By relying on the exception type to be in position 0 and the executable in position 1, I'd argue it could come to FNs when a developer uses that JUnit4 assertion. Do we want to support that case as well?
timeline.author: johann-beleites-sonarsource

replies.bodyText:
Good point!
JUnit 5 also has a message, but as the last parameter, everything works as expected.
And indeed, it is first in JUnit 4, I believe we should also support this case.

what about visiting newClasses as well? you can perfectly call constructors as well, which can define checkedExceptions:
new MyObjectThrowingException(methodThrowingException());

timeline.bodyText: I don't really like that you are going to visit the try-block multiple times, once for each catches exception. What about collecting them first and then triggering a visit a single time?
timeline.author: m-g-sonar

replies.bodyText: With the refactoring of the issue location, no need to visit the tree multiples times anymore!
replies.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: to be honest, I'm not sure this is still required in checks. From what I remember, we don't have situations anymore where semantic is not available.
